This page is a repository of links to useful information and tutorials. The links presented are broken up in to four categories and will include Ubuntu Forum resources, Ubuntu Wiki Resources and external resources. While this wiki page is maintained by the Education Focus group it is a product of the community for the community and you should feel free to modify it. If you know of a good resource please add it. If a resource has become out-of-date or the link is dead please feel free to remove the link.

If you would like to request a resource please do so in this <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=984986|thread]]</nowiki> on the Ubuntu forums.

----
'''__ IRC __''' - Many of the lessons/courses that will be run by the Education Focus Group will take place on IRC. For those that haven't used irc before there are a few wiki pages available. Pidgin is installed by default in Ubuntu and Xubuntu for Kubuntu there is Konversation, in addition there are many different irc clients available, including clients to use in a terminal, but an easy to use GUI application is xchat. These links give some information on <nowiki>[[http://developer.pidgin.im/wiki/Protocol Specific Questions#IRCProtocol|Pidgin]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://konversation.berlios.de/docs/using-kapp.html|Konversation]]</nowiki>,there is a wiki page for <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/XChatHowto|Xchat]]</nowiki> and finally a <nowiki>[[http://ubuntu-utah.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1012744|thread]]</nowiki> which should help you to reach the irc classroom, there is a reference in the thread to a java applet available from the classroom wiki page.----

'''__ Virtual terminal __''' - Some of the sessions will make use of a <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/BeginnersTeam/FocusGroups/Education/STS|virtual shared terminal]]</nowiki>
